content:
If you are planning to rename some declarations, chances are that those old names should be deprecated! If that is the case, there is a script that may be useful.

It is text-based, so it is a little flimsy, but should work well with simple enough modifications.

If your current (staged or committed) changes involve just renaming of lemmas, running ./scripts/add_deprecations.sh should automatically add deprecations for the renamed declarations.

The script can cope with more than just these modifications, but if you change a line that contains the name of a declarations (e.g. def XX := [modifications here]) the script may get confused. Chances are that it will still work as intended, since there is no automatic detection of a name change, but I would not trust it to do the right thing consistently.

The script has been tested on a few recent renames and all the issues that surfaced have been resolved. There is certainly scope for more issues to be uncovered, so if you use it and notice that something is off, please let me know!
